text: it's easy to make a good grain bowl but
making a great one takes thought and I'm
gonna walk you through it of course you
have to start with your grains you can
use one grain you can use a mix of grain
I like to use whole grains so over here
we have two different kinds of quinoa
and brown rice then you always need to
have something green some vegetable
matter so I've got steamed kale next you
need your pickled element you need
pickles because you have to have
something to kind of brighten up the
whole thing and it just adds a lot of
flavor and just lifts everything so I've
got kimchi then you need your protein
you need something to make this
sustaining so it will take you through
today so I have eggs hard-boiled or
soft-boiled you could use even fried
then something a little bit surprising
maybe something luxurious like avocado
YUM and last but not least you need a
sauce to bring everything together
because otherwise a rainbow will just
seem like a bunch of different things on
top of a bowl of rice now all you have
to do is throw it on top of your grains
start with kale and a layer in a corner
then kimchi right next to it an egg I'm
gonna burst it later a little bit of
avocado seaweed I just buy those little
seaweed snacks and crumble them up
you've got to have crunch you need
texture otherwise all of these soft
things just kind of disappear in your
mouth this will wake it up and the sauce
goes right on top peanut oil soy sauce
and ginger
now that you know all the elements you
can mix and match them as you see fit
use whatever you like suit the grain
will to your taste and if you love a
grain bowl they're a perfect place to
use up whatever tasty leftovers you have
in the fridge
